course: ENG 332 Communication for Business and Management
description: This course is designed for students in business and management or in related fields. Students will discuss and practice communication tasks that they can expect to perform in the workplace. Sample assignments include memo, career portfolio, proposal, evaluation, informal and formal report.

This course is designed for graduate students working in or seeking careers in industry. This course provides intensive instruction in effective engineering communication, clear writing style, writing effective reports and proposals, delivering strong presentations, and more.

course: ENG 333 Communication for Science and Research
description: This course aims to develop students' writing and communication skills so that they will be able to successfully navigate careers in scientific and research environments. Sample assignments include professional email, literature review, research funding proposal, and conference proposal.

This course examines environmental issues from ecological, ethical, political, and economic perspectives. Special emphasis is placed on the global dimension of ecological issues and the attempt to understand the value systems of different cultures.
